body_html: @terribilissimo I noticed that although your CUDA_PATH is that of CUDA 8, the CUDA 9 binaries will appear before that of CUDA 8 in PATH. You can confirm that using where nvcc.exe. You can try to use sth like set PATH=%CUDA_PATH%\bin;%PATH% to resolve this.
body_text: @terribilissimo I noticed that although your CUDA_PATH is that of CUDA 8, the CUDA 9 binaries will appear before that of CUDA 8 in PATH. You can confirm that using where nvcc.exe. You can try to use sth like set PATH=%CUDA_PATH%\bin;%PATH% to resolve this.
body: @terribilissimo I noticed that although your `CUDA_PATH` is that of CUDA 8, the CUDA 9 binaries will appear before that of CUDA 8 in `PATH`. You can confirm that using `where nvcc.exe`. You can try to use sth like `set PATH=%CUDA_PATH%\bin;%PATH%` to resolve this.
